title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with: button.DISPOSED which isn't even close to what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again, paying more attention this time. Code assist should notice that I have typed a ( and that this matches "dispose()" far better than "DISPOSED". Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when it is automatically inserting stuff.
OB: Build 204. While writing SWT code, when I type "button.dispose", the code assist list pops up. However, at this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is up because I am not looking. There are 2 items in the list now: DISPOSED, intWidgetDispose(), voidWidgetDispose().
EB: Build 204. While writing SWT code, when I type "button.dispose", the code assist list pops up. However, at this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is up because I am not looking. The expected behavior is that the code assist should not automatically insert any suggestions until I explicitly select one. If I type "(", then the code assist should insert "dispose()" rather than the currently selected suggestion.
SR:
1. Open Build 204 of the software.
2. Start writing SWT code.
3. Type "button.dispose" on a new line.
4. At this point, do not look at the code assist list that pops up.
5. Verify that the code assist does not automatically insert any suggestions without explicit selection.
6. Type "(", and verify that the code assist inserts "dispose()".
